newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian rupee slips to 35.80/81 on RBI dlr buying.
newsitem.headline: Indian rupee slips to 35.80/81 on RBI dlr buying.

text.p: The rupee slipped to 35.80/81 as the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) kept up its dollar purchases in early afternoon trade on Wednesday, dealers said.
"He started at 35.79 and took it upto 35.80," said a dealer at a foreign bank, referring to RBI intervention.
"It's quite aggressive. He (RBI dealer) is buying in $5.0-$10.0 million lots," he said. The rupee had opened steady at 35.76/77.
The rupee gained mildly against the forward dollar.
